response.answer_text: Not yet, although it is seeming as thought the band's future is unclear. Mike Shinoda has had a wonderful success with his solo album, Post-Traumatic, and I'd love to see more of his work with others like he did on projects like Fort Minor. So far, I seem to be the only one in these answers who doesn't want to see the band continue on without Chester. And I would greatly respect the band's decision to not continue as “Linkin Park” if they choose not to do so. How could listening to a full album without Chester Bennington be the same experience? I don't believe a band has to go on forever for their impact to last forever in our hearts. Look at all the fans, myself one of them, who have come out after Chester's passing and stated how his presence in LP's music affected them directly. I do respect that this decision has not been an easy one for Mike and the other band members to make hastily. As a fan since Hybrid Theory came out, I would prefer that they continue on their path as great musicians, but LP is not LP without Chester…let them change the band name if anything. And I don't think I'd be the only one who would be mad if he were replaced by a different frontman. Thank you for the A2A. RIP Chester.

Of course not! They just released their latest song on YouTube today. They’re releasing their new album “One More Light” on May 19. Of course their songs are sometimes messages about their current emotional status and with their newest release called “Good Goodbye” I can expect a lot of people to think what you asked. But I assure you, they’re not going anywhere anytime soon. They’re like brothers. They love their fanbase like family. Even in the past they gave us songs like “I’ll Be Gone”, “Waiting For The End”, etc. but here they are. They’re doing fine.

It hasn’t. YET. And let us all hope and pray that it never will, although its almost on the verge of getting disbanded. Its more like, after Chester’s death, Linkin Park has lost all its motivation, its lost all its fire. But, I believe that LP has still got some juice in it. It will go on. It HAS to. Millions of fans are there to support LP, and if they get disbanded, there will be millions of heart breaks. Lets all hope for the best. R.I.P Chester. You are one of my childhood heroes. \m/

Although all LP heads know that the lead singer, Chester Bennington died on July, the band is still alive. They have released an album called “One More Light” on May 2017, if you are still reeling from The Hunting Party. One of the band-members even stated that the band is in the process of healing from the wounds of the disaster, but they are still going to be together. Here’s to hoping for more songs from Linkin Park soon… Cheers and R.I.P. Chester!

Chester Bennington isn’t in Wellington dude, probably in hellington, and linkin park without Chester is like sizzlin pork without the pork, and the sizzling :v Better watch where you headed… (this) band, sure didn’t.
